Code

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>Learn Game Development at ZENVA.com</title>
    <!-- Just for basic styling. -->
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="assets/css/base.css" />
    <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/react/0.14.0/react.js"></script>
    <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/react/0.14.0/react-dom.js"></script>
    <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/babel-core/5.8.23/browser.min.js"></script>
  </head>
  <body>
    <div id="content"></div>
    <script type="text/babel" src="main.js"></script>
  </body>
</html>

Keyboard

You use keyboard shortcut CTRL + C and then CTRL + V to copy/paste a text.

Sample code

Block Formatting Context can be created by adding overflow: hidden; to a selector. On another note, here's an example of a thumbnail style : .thumbnail { padding: 5px; background: white; border: 1px solid gray; }

Variable

Don't forget to declare var kitty = new Kitty(); before trying var kittyBasket = [kitty, kitty];

(function(){
    var kitty = new Kitty();
    var kittyBasket = [kitty, kitty];
})();

Formatting a code block

You may use following formatting tags inside a code block :

  • u for uncommon elements, errors
  • b for bland, plain content like text
  • i for inconspicuous elements like comments
  • var for variables
  • em for emphasised elements - be aware it's not an accessibility good practice
  • strong for important elements - be aware it's not an accessibility good practice
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>Learn Game Development at ZENVA.com</title>
    <!-- Just for basic styling. -->
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="assets/css/base.css" />
    <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/react/0.14.0/react.js"></script>
    <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/react/0.14.0/react-dom.js"></script>
    <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/babel-core/5.8.23/browser.min.js"></script>
  </head>
  <body>
    <div id="content">
        This a wonderful content text, indeed.</em>
        <button onclick="handleClick();"></button>
    </div>
    <script type="text/babel" src="main.js"></script>
  </body>
</html>
